column4: does anyone know how I could set up my home computer as a proxy so I can connect through it at uni?
squid
is it graphical or through terminal?
terminal
You might consider a stand alone firewall, like IPcop.  See ipcop.org
okay thanks
I use IPcop
YOu might look into  tinyproxy
and firestarter
Or just squid and firestarter.  I've not done it, but maybe you can (without getting your hands dirty).
I have firestarter, it's impressive
In other words, I don't know.
I'm supposing your network is mixed, right?  If so, what are you accessing with this machine?  An internet connection?
I'd like to be able to use irc and http i suppose
You don't need a proxy to use irc and http. Am I missing something?
well my school network restricts http and probably blocks the irc ports
i have some config files lurking around in /etc that keep messing up my installation of squid, is it safe to delete them
Not sure.  What files?
actually it's just 'a' config file and it's in /etc/squid
Has squid been installed before?
yep and i think i screwed it up
Well, might be just as easy to fix what you have.
But you could uninstall squid and see what is left. If anything is still there, remove it and start over, install fresh.  e.g. rm -rf /etc/squid
